gov.usgs.util

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.util.Util

  • public class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of utility classes for the USGS codebase. TODO: this is starting to get unruly, decompose a bit.

      • escapeString

        public static java.lang.String escapeString(java.lang.String src,
                                            char c)
        Escapes a string for a given character by duplicating that character. Example: escapeString("Dan's example", '\'') would return "Dan''s example". This is useful for storing strings with quotes in a database.
        Parameters:
        src - the source string
        c - the character to duplicate
        Returns:
        the escaped string

      • outputData

        public static void outputData(java.lang.String fn,
                              java.lang.String hdr,
                              double[][] data)
        Outputs raw data to a text file. The first column is expected to be a j2ksec. The header string is written then lines of
        j2ksec,converted j2ksec,data,data, ...
        Text is comma delimited.
        Parameters:
        fn - the output file name
        hdr - the header String
        data - the data to write

      • outputData

        public static void outputData(java.lang.String fn,
                              java.lang.String hdr,
                              java.sql.ResultSet rs)
        Outputs raw data to a text file. The first column is expected to be a j2ksec. The header string is written then lines of
        j2ksec,converted j2ksec,data,data, ...
        Text is comma delimited.
        Parameters:
        fn - the output file name
        hdr - the header String
        rs - the ResultSet with the data

      • compress

        public static byte[] compress(byte[] bytes)
        Compresses an array of bytes using the JDK Inflator/ Deflator implementation set for maximum speed. Compression ratios comparable to gzip are attained.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array of bytes
        Returns:
        the compressed array of bytes

      • compress

        public static byte[] compress(byte[] bytes,
                              int level)
        Compresses an array of bytes using the JDK Inflator/ Deflator implementation. Compression ratios comparable to gzip are attained.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array of bytes
        level - the compression level (1[least]-9[most])
        Returns:
        the compressed array of bytes

      • compress

        public static byte[] compress(byte[] bytes,
                              int level,
                              int ofs,
                              int len)
        Compresses an array of bytes using the JDK Inflator/ Deflator implementation. Compression ratios comparable to gzip are attained.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array of bytes
        level - the compression level (1[least]-9[most])
        ofs - number of first byte in array to process
        len - length of processed array zone
        Returns:
        the compressed array of bytes

      • decompress

        public static byte[] decompress(byte[] bytes)
        Decompresses an array of bytes compressed via the Util.compress() methods. Uses a bufferSize of 64K.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the compressed bytes
        Returns:
        the decompressed array of bytes

      • decompress

        public static byte[] decompress(byte[] bytes,
                                int bufferSize)
        Decompresses an array of bytes compressed via the Util.compress() methods. Use a bufferSize slightly larger than the expected size of the decompressed data for maximum efficiency.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the compressed bytes
        bufferSize - the decompression buffer size
        Returns:
        the decompressed array of bytes

      • resize

        public static byte[] resize(byte[] b,
                            int i)
        Resizes a byte array either up or down, truncating or 0-padding. If the new size is the same as the old the original array is returned, otherwise a new array is returned leaving the original one unmodified.
        Parameters:
        b - the original byte array
        i - the new size
        Returns:
        the resized array

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception

        Main class method.

        Usage:

        without arguments - prints usage message

        -j2d [j2k] j2k to date

        -d2j [yyyymmddhhmmss] date to j2k

        -e2d [ewtime] earthworm to date

        -md5 [string] md5 of string

        -md5r [resource] md5 of a resource (filename, url)

        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
